alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 30 at 9:19AM HST until November 30 at 12:30PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Maui in Maui County * Until 1230 PM HST. * At 919 AM HST, radar indicated heavy rain continuing over the east and southeast slopes of Haleakala. The highest rain rates were 1 to 2 inches between Keanae and Hana. The Hana Highway remains closed between mile markers 40 and 41. Piilani Highway remains closed at mile marker 16 and mile markers 29 to 31. Rainfall is expected to continue into the afternoon. HAZARD...Heavy rain producing life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Significant and life threatening flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low lying areas. Multiple public road closures expected, as well as landslides in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kipahulu, Kaupo, Nahiku, Keanae, Hana, Haleakala National Park, Wailua and Hamoa. This warning may need to be extended beyond 1230 PM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. The heavy rains may cause rock and mudslides in steep terrain areas.
